[INST] What historical event is known for the extensive witch trials in Massachusetts? [/INST]

The Salem witch trials of 1692-1693 were a series of trials held in colonial Massachusetts..Љ The trials resulted in the execution of 20 people, mostly women, for witchcraft. The trials were sparked by a group of young girls who exhibited unusual behavior and were believed to be under the influence of witchcraft. The trials were characterized by a lack of due process, coerced confessions, and the use of spectral evidence. The trials were widely publicized and sparked a witch-hunt that spread throughout New England.

[INST] In which year was the first modern Olympic Games held? [/INST]

The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896. The idea of reviving the ancient Olympic Games was first proposed by French educator Pierre de Coubertin in 1892. Coubertin was inspired by the ancient Olympic Games, which were held in Olympia, Greece, every four years from 776 BC to 393 AD.
The first modern Olympic Games were held in 1896 in Athens, Greece.
